sense.name: miss, omit, or avoid
sense.examples: Tina skips class at least once a week. Mr. Hahn skipped first grade because his reading ability was so far above his classmates . Mr. Brown skipped his stop in nearby Chicago and set course for Memphis. He skipped over a row in the text and so the sentence was incomprehensible.

sense.name: jump lightly
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1[agent] SKIP (PP) NP1[animate] SKIP (PP)
sense.examples: Ann skipped merrily down the sidewalk. He skipped off across the fields.

sense.name: (cause to) bound off one point after another
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[inanimate] SKIP NP1[agent] SKIP NP2[inanimate] NP1[animate] SKIP NP2[inanimate]
sense.examples: The UFO skipped across the sky like a saucer. We spent many an afternoon skipping stones across the pond.

sense.name: leave suddenly
sense.examples: When Roger found out she was pregnant, he skipped town. After they have worked up a sweat, ringers often skip off to the local pub.
